Description: Head bead. With head in brown-red glass of the usual Semitic type, bearded. Opaque white thread decorations. The eyes are formed of globules of light-blue glass outlined with opaque white threads. A suspension loop, now lost, was on top of the head. Matt surface. Red core.
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (397)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
